title: BitcoinOrDeath
author: BitcoinOrDeath
created_time: June 10, 2023, 01:18:05 AMLast edit: June 18, 2023, 12:57:16 AM by BitcoinOrDeath
content: Handmade portrait of the legend Hal FinneyThe portrait is made from the natural wood grains of 2,132 walnut, blackwood and cherry wood pixels.Dimensions: W: 240mm x H: 305mm x D: 5mm (weight: 328grams)original source image: https://twitter.com/franfinney/status/1389643050771570688larger resolution of same images:https://talkimg.com/images/2023/06/10/A6EBq.jpeghttps://talkimg.com/images/2023/06/10/A6NkP.jpeghttps://talkimg.com/images/2023/06/10/A6sdj.jpegTime lapse of this piece being put together: https://twitter.com/woodpixart/status/1534044927247925248thank you, please let me know if you have any questionsAUCTION TERMSBid Format:  BTCStarting Bid: 0.006 BTCMinimum Bid Increment: 0.0005 BTCAuction End Time: Saturday, 17th June 2023 at 4:00:00 pm AEST  countdown clock: timeanddate countdownSniping:  No sniping. 10 minute standard sniping rule.Shipping: Paid for by buyer. Ships from Australia. Buyer responsible for any and all customs/duties Postage calculator (sent from postcode 2000): australia post shipping calculatorPayment Address: bc1q5tv694u6stqteaqnwsf8krky60caytddde7emg (happy to use escrow but you cover fees)Payment Due: Within 24 hoursEscrow: yes at cost of buyer

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Just watched your timelapse of the "construction" - pretty cool. Just wondering, did you just eye which shading/woodpiece to use next? - I was expecting you would have a print where you put each fitting piece on top of it, but there is nothing like this visible in the video.I think the result looks great.No space at all left here on my walls and I don't want a piece that will just be stored away, but good luck with your auction!

comments.author: BitcoinOrDeath
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on June 12, 2023, 04:45:11 PMJust watched your timelapse of the "construction" - pretty cool. Just wondering, did you just eye which shading/woodpiece to use next? - I was expecting you would have a print where you put each fitting piece on top of it, but there is nothing like this visible in the video.I think the result looks great.No space at all left here on my walls and I don't want a piece that will just be stored away, but good luck with your auction!It's hard to see in the timelapse but each pixel has a unique code, to determine placement position, on the back. These are all sorted and grouped before I begin assembly. Thanks for the kind words

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: Indeed that timelapse shows amazing skill and talent to pull this off!  Had to leave you some good merit for making this cool piece of artwork for sure!   Good luck with your auction and goodluck to the winner as well!

comments.author: BitcoinOrDeath
comments.body: thanks for participating in my auction and the kind words
